loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is 55 years old and married with three sons. She has been running a general store in front of her door for three years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband supports the family by selling second-hand electrical appliances.

Phung is requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing more household items and beauty products so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more household items and beauty products to sell from her store.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a 28-year-old lady from Kisumu city and is married to Joel, a tailor. They have two children who are 10 and 9 years old. She also supports her niece who is three years old.

Everline sells second hand garments mostly bras and under garments, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES 28,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of bras. She will then use then profits to pay school fees. Her dream is to open a boutique.

loans.use: To buy underwear to sell

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is 27 years old. He sells charcoal to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is an entrepreneur from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 49 years old, married and has a 23-year-old child. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Manuela has two businesses: hog raising and retail. She raises pigs to sell. She also runs a sari-sari store business and sells items like canned goods, toiletries and snacks. Manuela has requested a loan to purchase pig feed and more items to sell, such as canned goods and snacks. She hopes to help improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and more items to sell such as canned goods and snacks

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long is a 42-year-old married man. He lives with two sons and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife have earned money by running a general store for 15 years.

Long would like a loan to purchase a greater quantity and range of basic products (such as foods and toiletries) to sell from his general store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers. 

He also hopes that through his loan, he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity and range of basic products to sell from his general store

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 32-year-old lady from Nyalenda Kisumu who is married to Joseph who is a mason. They have four children.

Hellen operates a grocery stall, which has been operating for the last 10 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 6,000. She is taking her first loan at the moment, which she will use to buy more stock of fruits and green vegetables. She will save her profits for future use.

Her dream is to be stable financially and to uplift her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy fruits and green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Suong is 48 years old and married. She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She has run a general store at her house for 20 years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, and confectionery. 

Suong intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and helps her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
This is Peter, 54, a resident of Manila, Philippines. He is single. He manages his household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.  

Peter operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines and, while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. He will be incorporating the loan into his current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Peter hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his adopted children will be able to have a good future through all his hard work in his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business

loans.name: Kessia

texts.en:
Kessia is 36 years old and married to Patrick, who is a plumber. She is a mother of two children who are 13 and 7 years old.

Kessia operates a retail stall selling mainly soaps and sugar. She has been operating this business for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES 6,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of detergents and sugar to sell. Her profits will be used to pay school fees. Her dream is to buy a piece of land and build a family house.

loans.use: To buy a stock of detergents and sugar to sell

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en:
Muoi, 51 years old, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her two sons and her husband. She earns money by selling incense and worship products while her husband supports the family as a porter.

Muoi would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of products such as incense, incense burners, and worship-related objects to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, increasing sales and helping her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of products such as incense, incense burners, and worship-related items.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 27-year-old married woman with two children. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Maricel grows rice and cassava to sell. She earns 2,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Maricel works hard to help provide for her family's needs and keep them in good health.

Maricel has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for this loan to help improve her yield.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Zalimon

texts.en: Zalimon is a 32-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a parish chief for three years. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home. Zalimon intends to use the money to buy building materials for his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for his house.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
26-year-old Marjorie is a sari-sari store business owner from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with one child. Her husband works as a security guard.

Marjorie sells soft drinks, spices and canned goods in her store. She earns 3,000 PHP per month with this business. She does her best to help provide for their household needs and save for her child's future education.  Marjorie has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as toiletries, canned goods and snacks. She hopes this loan will help to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as toiletries, canned goods and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Taddeo

texts.en: Taddeo is a 34-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children, saving for a wedding and upgrading  his studies. He is a lecturer and has been in service for five years now .He has hardships of high fuel and transportation costs. He has a vision of buying land to grow crops and buying a car. Taddeo needs the loan facility to buy a laptop to ease his work.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Militona

texts.en: Militona is 48 years old and married with six children between the ages of 9 and 25 years old. Her husband works as a farmer. Militona is also a farmer. She has been growing rice for more than 10 years. She works hard to help sustain her family. She is planning to raise pigs to help augment their income. Militona requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, feeds and piglets. She hopes for this loan to help improve their businesses and standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, feed and piglets

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Asha operates a kiosk and sells her goods to friends and neighbors. She has been operating this kiosk for the last four years. 

She intends to use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase rice, sugar and cooking oil. She describes high transport costs to be her major challenge. Asha joined Yehu to access loans, and aspires to open a wholesale business in the future. Her greatest monthly expenditures are food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a forty-one year-old married lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. She is a teacher earning a salary per month and her dream is to set up an income generating activity so as to supplement her income. Margret needs a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 62-year-old married man with 10 children. He has been in the retail business for 17 years. He started with capital of 700,000 shillings and now has 5,000,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are price fluctuations and inflation, customers not paying on time and high taxes. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home. His professional goals are diversifying his business and expanding business into new markets. Samuel wants money to buy clothes, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Mwajeke

texts.en:
Mwajeke is a married man with nine children, none of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwajeke operates a retail shop and sells his goods mostly to his neighbors and passersby. He aspires to hire employees in the future. His other sources of income include earnings from his wife, a businesswoman.

He plans to use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy stock of beans, sugar and wheat flour. He joined Yehu to access loans to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy stock of beans, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a forty-two year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been a retailer for the last six years and his major hardship is price fluctuation and inflation; however, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming. Paul needs a loan to buy stock such as sugar and salt for resale.

loans.use: to buy stock such as sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to build a permanent home. He has been selling bananas for five years now; his major hardship is price fluctuation and inflation. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets. Ibrahim needs a loan to buy bananas for resale.

loans.use: to buy bananas for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a widowed woman with six children, five of whom are enrolled in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She operates a kiosk and a green grocery, and has been doing so for the last seven years. She joined Yehu to access loans, and aspires to open a new kiosk in the future. Poor transportation infrastructure is her major challenge. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
With the Ksh. 25,000, she intends to purchase stock for her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her businesses.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas sells used paper and other materials in the town of Ndunyu Njeru. She also has a tailoring business. She is 48 years of age, and a mother to three children aged 24, 20, and 16 years old. 

She plans to use this loan amount to buy more stock of used paper for sale in her business. She anticipates to use the profits to boost her tailoring business.

In the future, Dorcas hopes to grow her business and distribute waste materials to manufacturing industries to make more income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To add more stock of used papers for sale.

loans.name: Mwanamgeni

texts.en: Mwanamgeni would like to thank Kiva for the previous loan that really boosted her business. She was able to expand the business and hire employees to assist her. She is requesting another loan to continue with the same business, and she dreams of even opening a fish depot in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 42 years-old lady from Nyalenda Kisumu and is single, but supports her four children aged between 11 and 18 years-old.

Millicent operates a grocery stall where she sells fruits such as avocados, oranges, bananas, and other groceries like tomatoes. She has operated this stall for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD that she will use to buy a stock of fruits and vegetables. 

She will use profits to pay school fees. Her dream is to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy a stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (cousin and sister). Aida has a tailoring business. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Aida sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Aida has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing materials.  She also generates additional income through poultry farming. The main business challenge(s) for Aida include defaulters and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to have three sewing machines and also to own a shop for her tailoring business. Aida lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and medical bills.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials

loans.name: Bechaga

texts.en:
Bechaga is a married man with six children, two are enrolled in school. He has a door-to-door business selling milk, and has been in the business for four years. His primary customers include his neighbors, and he aspires to open a shop in the future. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Bechaga joined Yehu due to their low loan interest rate.

He plans to use the Ksh 40,000 to open a stall to sell milk. His greatest monthly expenditures include school fees and food.

loans.use: to open a stall to sell milk.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
This is Christopher, 36, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Vergie, a housewife and the mother of his four children. Together they manage their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Christopher operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these items to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stacks, cleans, and gathers huge quantities of these materials and sells them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. He will be incorporating the loan on his current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Christopher hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his children will be able to have good future through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in his business

loans.name: Yajaira Katherine

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.

Aquí conocimos a la señorita Yajaira, tiene  20 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ella estudia el tercer semestre de marketing en una Universidad  de Manta. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por 6 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda y porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses.

Ella además de dedicarse a sus estudios también se dedica junto a su madre a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ellas tienen un local en su casa. Allí trabajan todos los días desde  las 8h00  hasta 18h00, también ella lleva mercadería a vender en la universidad en la cual estudia, recibe la mercadería  en Portoviejo ya que se la envían desde Panamá y Perú, lo que más venden es la ropa femenina y la de niños aunque tienen de todo y para toda edad,  llevan en este negocio ya por 3 años y que les ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños y ropa interior.

Sus sueños son terminar su carrera profesional y llegar a ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
In the citadel of Circunvalación, in the city of Manta, every 15 days there is a meeting for Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are well-visited year-round by national and international tourists.  It is also known as one of the most important ports of the country and of the Americas, located on the shores of the Pacific.

It is here that we find Yajaira, 20 years old, single, and living in her parents' home.  She is in the third semester at the University of Manta, studying Marketing.  She has been working with Banco Comunal now for six cycles and she likes them for their support and because the credit comes with very low interest.

Besides dedicating herself to her studies, she is working with her mother selling clothing of all types.  They have a store in their home.  There they work every day from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She also takes merchandise to sell at the university where she studies and receives merchandise in Portoviejo, as they send from Panamá and Perú.

She mostly sells women's and children's clothing, although they offer all types of clothing for every age.  She has had the business for three years and has done very well.  

The purpose of this loan is to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing and underwear.  Her dream is to complete her studies and become a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing and underwear.

loans.name: Flor Anthonieta

texts.es: Flor de 67 años vive (suburbio  Guayaquil) .ella empezó este negocio porque le gusta   hace 10 años siendo modista . su hijo le propuso poner un bazar ya que por su cas no había bazar y lo hixo y le va bien.  Tiene su local pero la dificultad  es  la delincuencia . Es madre soltera  tiene 1 hijo mayor de edad . A futuro ella anhela terminar su casa. Con el préstamo comprara (cuadernos, plumas, telas).
texts.en: Flor, 67, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. She started her business because she enjoys it and has been a dressmaker for the 10 years. Her son proposed setting up a bazaar in her house, which they did and it is doing very well. She has her premises, but the main difficulty is crime. Flor is a single mother with a grown-up son. In the future she longs to finish her house. With this loan Flor will purchase notebooks, pens, and fabric.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pens, and fabric.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Tarcilla

texts.es: María e de 47 años vive (suburbio Guayaquil). Ella decidió entra a este negocio por su esposo se lo propuso  y ella lo hizo. Puso su bazar y le va muy bien aparte vende cosméticos. Es casa  tiene 2 hijos. A futuro anhela tener su familia bien  y mejorar su negocio. Con el préstamo comprara (blusas útiles escolares ).
texts.en: María, 47, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. She decided to set up her business following a suggestion from her husband. She set up her bazaar and is doing very well selling cosmetics. She has 2 children at home. In future she longs for her family to do well and to improve her business. With this loan  María will purchase books, cosmetics and school supplies.

loans.use: to purchase books, cosmetics and stationery.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: El Sr. Tomas  tiene 37 años, no es casada pero convive con su pareja con el que tiene  3 hijos que son de las edades de 10, 8 y 5 años, se dedica a la  agricultura tiene su parcela  que se encuentran en la localidad de  Villa Esperanza,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Tomas utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de semillas para la siembra de Papa, el Sr. Tomas  enfrenta retos en su negocio que es el clima ya que esta época de lluvias le perjudica en sus sembradíos, y utilizara los beneficios del crédito en mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, su deseo es seguir gozando de salud y trabajando duro para  salir de la pobreza, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
37-year-old Tomas is not married but lives with his partner with whom he has 3 children aged 10, 8 and 5 years. He is a farmer and has a plot of land in the town of Villa Esperanza.

This loan is his first cycle with the institution, and Tomas will use this loan to buy seeds for planting potatoes. The main challenge that Tomas faces in his business is the weather, as the rain can harm his crops during this season. Tomas will use this loan to improve the quality of life for himself and his family. His desire is to continue enjoying health and work hard to overcome poverty. He is happy and grateful to the institution for the support.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has been practicing farming in Njabini for the past 15 years. She is 58 years-old, and a widow with two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the existing customers; she plans to use this loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting, and animal feed for her dairy cattle.

In the future, Ruth hopes to improve her farming methods, thereby making more income and providing a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seedlings, and animal feed.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all her children are in school. She also takes care of two additional family members (her sister and her child). She sells green bananas at the market. She sells her products on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last seven months. She works six days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of matooke (green bananas). Her major business challenge is seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and also to start going to the village of Masaka for bananas. She lives in her own house and family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy slippers and flip-flops wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Fanice

texts.en:
Fanice is a thirty-nine-year-old lady from Nyalenda area of Kisumu city and is married to Hezron. They have five children aged fifteen, thirteen, twelve, ten and eight.  

Fanice operates a water selling business, a business she has been doing for the last ten years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to open a water kiosk. She will use the profits to to educate her children. Her dream is to buy a piece of land and also ensure that her kids gets well educated.

loans.use: To open a water kiosk.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives together with her husband and three children in Mpohor near Takoradi. Her husband is a teacher. Agnes cooks yams for sale. She serves them with a fish and vegetable stew. She has been doing this for seven years now.  She uses her income to support her husband to feed and cloth their children. 

Agnes will use her loan to purchases yams, fish and vegetables to prepare the food she sells. With the new profit, Agnes wishes to set up a better stall to serve her customers.

loans.use: purchases yams, fish and vegetables to prepare the food that she sells.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a fruit vender and sells bannana at Mpohor near Takoradi. She has done this for two years now. She is married with two children and her husband is a miner. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Abena will use her loan to purchase variety of fruit to satisfy her customers. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase a variety of fruit to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child who is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her grandmother). She sells pancakes and groundnuts. She sells her products on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last six months. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, cassava flour and sugar. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the increasing prices of cooking oil. Her goals and aspirations are to open a retail shop. She lives in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more cassava flour, cooking oil and ground nuts.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 28 years-old lady from Kisumu and is married to Charles, a driver. They have three children aged nine, six, and two years.

Christine operates a retail shop, a business she has been doing for the last two years and makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD that she will use to buy retail stock of sugar and cooking oil for sale. 

Christine will use her profits to add more retail stock. Her dream is to open another shop outlet.

loans.use: To buy retail stock of sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in Logan Town. She is forty years old. Since 2008, she has been running a small drug and general store in her community where in addition to drugs, she sells items such as nutritional food for babies and sodas. She started this business with a little amount of money that she earned when she  worked as a nurse after she graduated from a nursing school. She is single and has three children between the ages of twelve and twenty-one. They live at home and attend school. She hopes to help more people with her services and continue to support her children to go to school. 

Hawa is requesting a loan to buy more items for her business including drugs such as paracetamol to reduce fevers and cough syrup, as well as sodas and nutritional food for babies.

loans.use: to buy a range of items for her business including drugs such as paracetamol and cough syrup, sodas and nutritional food for babies.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells charcoal in Mpohor near Takoradi. She has done this for three years now. Ama is a divorced and has six dependents. She uses her income for the general up-keep of her children. Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia sells provisions and also operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold). She has done this for two years. The food  she  serves  are fufu, banku, meat soup, fish soup, and rice balls. She is married to a miner and has four children. Cecilia uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. 

She will use her loan to purchase groceries for her shop and maize, cassava, bush meat and other ingredient to prepare the African dishes she sells. With the new profit, Cecilia plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her shop and maize, cassava, bush meat and other ingredients to prepare African dishes to sell.

loans.name: Mwanabarawa

texts.en:
Mwanabarawa is grateful to Kiva for the previous loan that boosted her retail business. It enabled her to increase her stock and she is now requesting another loan to invest in the same business. 

With the KES 50,000, she intends to buy more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, and two sacks of sugar.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, and two sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Sesseh

texts.en:
Sesseh operates a grocery shop, something she has done for some years now. The items in her grocery shop are soap, cooking oil, tinned tomatoes, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees and powdered milk. She is married with three children. Sesseh uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills. 

She will use her loan to purchase variety of groceries to sell. Sesseh plans to expand her grocery shop with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es: El Sr. Gerónimo  tiene 20 años no es casado pero tiene pareja con quien tiene un  bebe de 6 meses, el se dedica a la   agricultura su parcela se  encuentran en la localidad de Villa Esperanza, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Gerónimo  utilizara  este préstamo  para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y cosecha de maíz, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo, el Sr. Gerónimo utilizara los beneficios en mejorar su rendimiento en la siembra y cosecha de productos, el Sr. Gerónimo es una persona joven y trabajadora con ganas de seguir adelante, para mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, se siente muy agradecido con la institución por la   oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Gerónimo is 20 years old. He is not married but he is in a relationship. The couple has a six month old baby. He is a farmer. His plot is located in Villa Esperanza. This loan is the second with the institution. Gerónimo will use this loan to purchase seeds for planting corn and to harvest corn. His reason for requesting the loan is to increase his working capital. Gerónimo will use the benefits to improve the performance of planting and harvesting products. Gerónimo is a young and hard working person who wants to move forward in order to improve the quality of life for his whole family. He feels very grateful to the institution for the opportunity offered to him.

loans.use: plant potatoes and harvest corn.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a food vender. She cooks banku to sell and serves it with okra and fish-stew in Mpoho near Takoradi. She is married and has six children. Her husband is retired. Mary has been doing this for seven years. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their for the general up-keep of their family.  

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing the banku she sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to set up a stall to sell of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses to prepare banku to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells rice porridge. She serves the porridge with bread in Mpohor near Takoradi. She is a single parent and has three children. Ekua has been selling rice porridge for three years now. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. 

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice and flour to prepare her porridge and bread for sale. With the new profit, Ekua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and flour to prepare her porridge and bread for sale.

loans.name: Honest Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of borrowers from the eastern city of Kenema. This group of borrowers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of 2,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to expand their businesses. 

Gbassay is the leader of this group. A native of Kenema, Gbassay is married and has five children attending primary and secondary school. Gbassay has been a businesswoman for more than fifteen years now. She sells fish. She has requested this loan in order to buy a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en:
Auntie lives together with her husband, who is a teacher, and four children in Mpohor near Takoradi. She operate a grocery shop and this she has done for some  years now. The items in her grocery shop are soap, cooking oil, tinned tomatoes, and different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk. Auntie uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills. 

She will use her loan to purchase variety of groceries to satisfy her customers. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase variety of grocery to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells maize and also cooks food for sale in Mpohor near Takoradi. She has been selling maize for eleven years now. She is married and has five children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accommodation and utility bills.  

Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to sell and food supplies to prepare food for sale. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell and food supplies to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre du groupe de crédit  Kalamo, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 35 ans. Elle est  vendeuse de braises, farine de manioc. Son mari est casseur de pierres. Il ya  5 ans qu’elle  fait le petit commerce. Plus tard, elle fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour renforcer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  3eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  d’acheter 3 chèvres pour le petit élevage en fin d’occuper son mari.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et améliorer sa maison dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: The customer, who is a member of the Kalamo loan group, is a dynamic woman and entrepreneur, who is 35 years old. She sells live embers and cassava flour. Her husband breaks up stones. For the past five years she has had a small trading activity. More recently she was informed about the microloans granted by IMF Hekima and so she took advantage of her first loan of USD 50 to strengthen her business. The profits from her business are used to build up her savings, for food and to help out with her children's schooling. Meanwhile, she has been granted her third loan. During this period, the customer has seen her business prosper. So she has decided to increase the amount of her loan for this new cycle. The new loan will allow her to buy three goats for raising, so that her husband will have something to occupy himeself with. For the future she wants to see her children grow up and improve her house. The customer is grateful to Hekima for its actions to make poor women with low incomes autonomous.

loans.use: to buy three goats

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto , es un humilde agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , su esposa se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras para apoyarlos con los gastos del hogar , don Roberto se encuentra en una situación muy difícil con el cultivo ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos para su mantención debida , y no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para poder restablecerlo y así salir adelante , ya con la venta de este producto , su familia puede llevar el pan de cada día para su alimentación . El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos agrícolas. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondo ya que son mucho los agricultores que logran sus sueños con esta ayuda que les proporcionan.
texts.en: Roberto is a humble farmer from the Ticuantepe area. Together with his family, his plans for the future are to improve their living conditions. His wife works selling fruits and vegetables to help with the family expenses. Roberto finds himself in a very difficult situation with his crops as he doesn't have the fertilizers and supplies he needs for them and he doesn't have the financial resources he needs to get them and then be successful. The sale of this product allows his family to have their daily bread. He needs the loan to buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies. He is grateful for the support that Afodenic offers him as many farmers achieve their dreams with the help they make available.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana operates a grocery shop and has done this for some years now. The items in her grocery shop are soap, cooking oil, tinned tomatoes, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees and powdered milk. She is married with three children. Nana uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  

She will use her loan to purchase variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Nana plans to expand her grocery shop.

loans.use: purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en:
Auntie is married to a driver and has four children. They live together in Mpoho near Takoradi. She operates a grocery shop. Some of the items she sells are tinned fish, tin tomatoes, milk, soap and sugar. She uses her income to support her husband in the general up-keep of their family. 

Auntie will use her loan to purchase variety of groceries to satisfy her customers. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase variety of groceries to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a thirty-year-old lady from Kisumu. She is married to Kennedy and they have three children aged ten, eight and four years. 

Linda operates a clothes-selling business , a business she has been doing for the last ten years. She makes a monthly income of KES 5,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy a stock of adult clothing for sale. 

She will then use profits to pay school fees and also provide for her family's needs. Her dream is to buy a piece of land and build a family house.

loans.use: To buy a stock of adult clothing to sell.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Couturière de profession, Améyo est une femme de 35ans. Elle est mariée à un transitaire et a 02 enfants tous à l école. Le premier a 08ans et le dernier 04ans. En plus de la couture, elle vend des articles de mercerie et sa difficulté est le manque d’apprentis. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des produits de mercerie pour mieux répondre aux besoins de ses nombreux clients. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité, aménager l’atelier de couture et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants. Elle a démarré en 2001.
texts.en: Améyo, who is a seamistress by profession, is a 35-year old woman. She is married to a freight broker and has two children who are both at school. The eldest is eight years old and the youngest four. As well as sewing, she sells haberdashery products and her difficulty is the lack of apprentices. She is requesting this first loan to buy haberdashery products so that she can satisfy her numerous customers' demands. She wants to reinvest in her business, refurbish her sewing workshop and provide fr her children's education. She began her activity in 2001.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery products

loans.name: La Paix Group

texts.fr: Le groupement LA PAIX est composé de douze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom Olympiade est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Olympiade est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Olympiade n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Olympiade est mariée à un peintre auto du nom de Félix. Le couple a deux enfants à leur charge dont un est leur propre enfant et est scolarisé. Olympiade vit ensemble avec son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Olympiade vend depuis cinq ans, du charbon de bois, de tubercules d'igname et de façon secondaire des tissus et des bijoux par le système de distribution. Olympiade dans des régions du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Olympiade sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement LA PAIX, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The La Paix group is made up of twelve people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé, in order to increase their business volume. The representative of the group, whose name is Olympiade, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Olympiade is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school and is now married to a car painter whose name is Félix. The couple has two children in their care, one of whom is their own and at school. Olympiade lives with her husband and they cover the various family expenses between them. In order to be able to contribute to these various family expenses, Olympiade has for the past five years been selling charcoal, yam tubers, and as a secondary activity, has been selling fabrics and jewelry through the distribution system. She sells in the various regions of Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and increasing both her turnover and income, Olympiade is requesting, together with the other members of the La Paix group, a second loan from Alidé. The previous loan has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy sacks of yam tubers and fabric

loans.name: Moises Elias

texts.es: Moisés Elías es una emprendedor que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en el cual  se le ha brindado crédito y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseos de superación en lo personal y en su negocio. El emprendedor nos expresa que con el apoyo en el financiamiento ha aumentado su producto además sus clientes también, actualmente está  solicitando nuevamente crédito para comprar más cerdos y comida para los animales.
texts.en: Moisés Elías is an entrepreneur who has been working with Fundación León 2000. He has been offered a loan and has demonstrated that he is a responsible person with desires of improving his personal and business situations. The entrepreneur expresses that with the support of the loan, he has expanded his product as well as his customer base. Now he is requesting a new loan to purchase more pigs and food for the animals.

loans.use: purchase pigs and food for the animals.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: La Sra. Lola  tiene 52 años, no esta casada pero tiene su pareja con la que tiene un hijo de 7 años, se dedica a la agricultura siembra de papa y maíz y también se dedica a la crianza de chanchos en su parcela  que se encuentran en la localidad de Parabanocito,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lola utilizara  este préstamo  para comprar material de construcción para la construcción  de un  galpón para la crianza de  chanchos  y también para la compra de alimento balanceado, la Sra. Lola enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y utilizara los beneficios para  mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia.  Sueña con el tiempo  ser uno de las mejores agricultoras y tener una granja grande para así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Lola is 52 years old. She is not married but she is in a relationship. The couple has a seven year old son. She is a potato farmer. She also raises pigs on her plot in the city of Parabanocito. This loan is her first with the institution. Lola will use the loan to purchase construction materials for a shed to raise the pigs as well as to purchase balanced feed. Lola faces challenges in her business in order to get out of poverty. she will use the benefits to improve her and her family’s quality of life. She dreams that with time, she will be one of the best farmers and will have a big farm in order to improve her economic earnings. She feels happy and she is thankful for the support that the institution provides.

loans.use: construct a shed for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria De La Cocepcion

texts.es: La señora María , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes futuros es poder diversificar el cultivo y hacer su casita de bloques ya que la que tiene actualmente es plástico con cartón y pedazos de zinc ya muy viejos , ella es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora toda su vida se a dedica a la siembras de piña , actualmente enfrenta una problemática con el cultivo de piña  ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para poderle dar en mantenimiento adecuado y así sacar una producción de calidad . El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos .Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondo Kiva ya que sin estos proyecto de apoyo para las personas del campo no podrían sacar adelante la plantación .
texts.en: María lives in the town of Ticuantepe along with her family. Her plan for the future is to be able to diversify her crops and to build her house using cinder blocks as the house she has now is made of plastic with cardboard and pieces of zinc and is very old. She is a very hardworking woman and has spent her whole life growing pineapples. She is currently facing a problem growing her pineapples as she doesn't have the fertilizers and supplies necessary to give them adequate care and end up with a high quality product. She wants the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies. She is grateful for the trust put in her by Afodenic through Kiva because, without these projects to support rural people, they can't carry on with their farms.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a married mother of three, cooks rice with fish stew to sell in Mpohor, near Takoradi. She also operates a grocery shop carrying a variety of soft drinks, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk, using her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills.

Agnes is requesting this loan to purchase bags of rice and other ingredients for food preparation and a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers. With the resulting new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and other ingredients for food preparation and a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has owned a retail shop business in Nyahururu town for the last three years. She is 27 years old, married to Robert and they have been blessed with one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the staff members.  This will be her first loan from KADET LTD.She plans to use this loan amount to buy more stock of sugar, rice, bar soap and cooking fat.This will enable her to serve her clients well and also meet their demands.

In the future, Jane hopes to expand her business and open a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, rice, bar soap and cooking fat.

loans.name: Erica Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Erica, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo , el cual labora en una empresa privada para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen un hijos menor de edad , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ya que donde habitan actualmente su abuelita le heredo un pedazo de la humilde , pero su salario no le ajusta para invertir en materiales de construcción y darle una mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia ; ya que ella labora en empresa privada como apoyo de los ambientalista. El préstamo lo quiere para realizar una división ya que la que tiene es solo un par de sabanas y cartones. Agradece la confianza que le brinda para poder realizar sus sueños y algún día disfrutar de comodidad.
texts.en: Erica lives in the town of Ticuantepe along with her husband who works in a private company so that he can support the household's expenses. They have one little boy. Her plan for the future is to improve their living conditions as they currently live in part of the humble home that her grandmother left. Her salary is not enough to buy construction materials and give a better quality of life to her family. She works in a private company supporting some environmentalists. She wants the loan to build a dividing wall as the wall is currently just a pair of sheets and cardboard. She is grateful for the trust put in her to be able to realize her dreams and, one day, to be comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Ana Amada

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progreso Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad  y uno de 12 años, todos sus hijos estudian en universidad y el menor en colegio, todos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto contribuir con la dura tarea de mantener el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, tiene un pequeño local en su casa aunque también realiza sus ventas puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días desde las  8h00 hasta las 18h00, vende al contado y también deja a crédito a sus clientes  más conocidos y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el sexto ciclo que se formo el banco, es la fiscal de reglamentos  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The community bank Progreso Del Mar meets every two weeks in the beautiful spa-town of San Mateo, part of the city of Manta, which is know for its beautiful beaches which are visited year-round by national and foreign tourists. In this place, most of the people work in the fishing industry and at other tasks related to the sea. 
In this place, we met Ana. She is 44 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are grown-up and one who is 12 years old. All her children study at the university or, in the case of the younger one, in high school. They all still live with her. Her husband is a fisherman.
To earn something of her own and, in this way, contribute to the hard task of keeping the household, she works selling all types of clothes. She has a little store in her home but she also sells door to door. She works every day from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She sells for cash and also offers credit to the customers that she knows well and collects every two weeks. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise every two weeks or every month as needed. She has been doing this for 12 years and it is going well.
She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as: plants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes. She has been with the community bank since its sixth loan cycle and she likes it for the help that is given to the borrowers. 
Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with 7 children, 3 girls and 4 boys, all enrolled in school. She operates a fish-selling business and has been in the business for 10 years. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she will add stock of fish to her business. Mwanakombo aims at opening a new kiosk, and she describes her challenge to be seasonality, i.e., the scarcity of fish during winter. She joined Yehu to get loans. She spends more on food and school fees during the month.

loans.use: to add stock of fish to her business.

loans.name: Sorry For We Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the “Sorry for We” solidarity lending group. They approached SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to acquire a loan of 3,100,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to expand on the sizes and qualities of their respective businesses. With an expansion on their business inventory, their business will be able to attract so many customers, thus increasing trade and profit. 

Hawa is the leader of this group of borrowers. She is a native of Talia village. She is a wife of a motor driver and a mother of four school-going children. Hawa has had over 20 years of experience in trading. She is currently selling fish. She has requested this loan in order to buy a larger quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Vura

texts.en: Vura is a married man with 9 children, 4 of whom are enrolled in school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He keeps goats for sale at the market, and he describes his major challenge to be high transportation cost to the market. Vura has been in the business for the last 15 years. He joined Yehu because it offers good services. He intends to use the 25,000 KES to buy more goats for resale. His greatest monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a fish monger and petty trader. Some of the items she sells are food items like cooking oil, salt, pepper, tomatoes, cabbages and other vegetables. Margaret is married with 4 children. Her husband is a carpenter. She uses her income to support the husband to pay their children’s school fees. Margaret will use her loan to purchase fish and food items to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase fish and food items to sell

loans.name: Basil

texts.en:
Basil is 34 years old and married. He lives with his wife, and he is from Gaza.

On January 1st 2011, he opened his own mini-market, and he hopes to expand it into a supermarket in the future. He needs this loan to buy more goods, a refrigerator, and to expand the size of his store. He hopes that this loan will improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more goods and a refrigerator for his market.

loans.name: Sairagul

texts.ru:
Сайрагул 61 год. В 2008 году , в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Сайрагул начала свой бизнес в  животноводстве со стартовой суммы 40,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня,  в хозяйстве Сайрагул имеется  3 дойные коровы, 25голов овец и 3 головы лошади. Доходы от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляют примерно 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сайрагул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Сайрагул вместе с сыном  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства посредством посадки картофеля на земле мерою 0,3 га .
texts.en:
Sairagul is 61 years old. In 2008, in search of an income for her family, Sairagul started her business of livestock breeding with a starting sum of 40,000 som (KGS). Today Sairagul has 3 cows, 25 sheep and 3 horses at her farm. The income from selling milk and dairy products is around 5,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With the aim to further develop her business, Sairagul turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of livestock. Sairagul, together with her son, plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding the farm through the planting of potatoes in a land plot of 0.3 hectares.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
El Grupo perseverante esta ubicado en la comunidad de san agustin el cual se caracteriza por que a sus alrededores hay muchas huleras(arboles de hule) y su gente  se dedica al corte de caña y la recoleccion de las recinas de los hules, este grupo esta integrado por 11 mujeres cada una de ellas desarolla una actividad economica con la intención de ganar un poco de dinero para poder apoyar y dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.

Maria Cohinta es uno de sus intregantes ella tiene la edad de 40 años, estudios la universidad y esta casada con Edgar, ella tiene 4 hijos. Doña maria Cohinta siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora la cual a trabajado para poder ayudar con los gastos de su hogar pero hace un poco mas de un año decidió poner una papeleria ya que ella piensa que se gana mejor trabajando en un negocio propio. 

Ella tiene su negocio en su hogar y habré desde muy temprano para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, tambien nos dice que le gusta tener un poco de todo para que siempre encuentren lo que buscan, lo que mas le guata de su negocio es que le da tiempo de atenderlo sin descuidar a su familia ademas de que brinda un servicio a sus amigos de la comunidad.

Maria Cohinta utilizara ete credito para la compra de compra de gomas, lapices, lapicero, hojas blancas y de color, resistol, sacapuntas,cartulinas, papel bond, plumones, marcatextos.

ella espera que con este credito su negocio continue progresando ya que desea seguir ampliando su negocio y surtirlo mas.

Este grupo agradece a la fundacion por el credito y la confianza que le han otorgado.
reyna ciber
loyda simbra y cultivo de maiz
adilene venta de calzado
victoria reposteria
maria concepcion venta de refrescos
Carmela articulos para el hogar(trastes)
matilde venta de perfumes
luz del carmen venta de refrescos
Cecilia venta de antojitos
Smirna articulos para el hogar(trastes)
texts.en:
The group Perseverante is located in the community of San Agustin which is characterized by having many rubber trees in its outskirts and by its people who work cutting sugar cane. This group is comprised of 11 women, each of whom has developed a business with the intention of earning a little money to be able to support their family and give them a better quality of life. 
Maria Cohinta is one of the group members. She is 40 years old, studied in the university, and is married to Edgar. She has 4 children. Maria Cohinta has always been a hardworking woman who has worked to help with the household expenses but, a little more than a year ago, she decided to open a stationery store as she thinks that she will earn more working in her own business. 
She has her business in her home and opens very early so that she can give her customers good service. She also tells us that she likes to have a little of everything so that her customers can always find what they need. What she most likes about her business is that she has time to run it without neglecting her family and that she can offer a service to her friends in the community. 
Maria Cohinta will use this loan to buy erasers, pencils, pens, sheets of white and colored paper, glue, pencil sharpeners, construction paper, bond paper, and markers. 
She hopes that, with this loan, her business will continue to develop as she wants to keep growing the business and increasing the stock.
This group is grateful to the foundation for the loan and the trust that has been placed in them. 
Reyna has a cybercafe. 
Loyda grows and harvests corn.
Adilene sells shoes.
Victoria makes pastries. 
Maria Concepcion sells soft drinks.
Carmela sells household goods.
Matilde sells perfumes. 
Luz del Carmen sells soft drinks.
Cecilia sells snacks. 
Smirna sells household goods.

loans.use: to buy erasers, pencils, pens, white and colored paper, glue, pencil sharpeners, construction paper, bond paper, and markers.

loans.name: Takuru Group

texts.en:
Abu Bakarr is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Abu Bakarr was born in Kenema city 39 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has four children who are attending secondary and primary schools. 

Abu Bakarr sells clothes and has been a businessman for 14 years now. With the help of this loan, Abu Bakarr and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Abu Bakarr will use his share of the loan (800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL)) to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to his current stock for sale.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to his current stock for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 48 years old. He is married to Grace, and together, they have three children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for use during planting.

He hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for use during planting.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is the lady standing in front of the oven. She is a baker; she bakes bread for sale in Mpohor near Takoradi. She has been baking for six years now. She is married to a driver and has two children. 

She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their children. Christiana will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery. With the new profit from her expanded business, she will buy the modern type of oven to make baking easier.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 40 years old. He is married to Judice, and together, they have four children. He sells shoes and has been in the business for the past 25 years.

This is his first term loan with KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET by a client. He will use the loan to purchase more stock of shoes for sale in his business.

He hopes to expand his business and open a shoe-selling shop in town.

loans.use: To purchase stock of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 50 years old. She is married to Edward and together they have three children. She sells peanuts and snacks and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is her first loan in KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET by a client. She will use the loan to purchase stock of snacks including peanuts.

She hopes to own a permanent place to sell her snacks instead of hawking.

loans.use: to purchase stock of snacks including peanuts.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives together with her husband and three children at Mpohor.  Florence operates a grocery shop, which she has done for some years now.  The items in her grocery store are different kinds of soft drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, tin milk and others.  Florence uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 40 years old and married to Susan. He has been a potato and peas farmer in Nakuru for the last four years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of his friends and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to plow his farm land in readiness for the planting season. The loan will also be used for tractor hire and labor fees.

In the future, John hopes to plant more cash crops like beans and maize and hence make more income.

loans.use: To plow land using a tractor.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a petty trader. She sells slippers. She also operates a grocery shop at Mpohor near Takoradi, and  this she has done for some two years now.   The items in her grocery shop are soap, cooking oil, tins of tomatoes, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk and others. 

She is married and has five children. Nana uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Nana plans to expand her grocery shop.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has been selling clothes in Nakuru town for the last seven years. She is 30 years old, married to Christopher and they have one child.

This will be her first loan and she plans to buy more stock of clothes, mainly jackets, jumpers and sweaters, for adults and children.

Being a cold season, the demand has been high and this will enable her to serve her clients well and meet their demands.

In the future, Jane hopes to grow her business and thereby open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes, mainly jackets, jumpers and sweaters.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame operates a boutique. Some of the items she sells are shoes, bags and ladies' wear. She has done this for six years now. 

She is married and has four children. Her husband is a trader. She uses her income to help her husband to support their children. 

Maame will use her loan to purchase more bags, shoes and ladies' wear to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bags, shoes and ladies' wear to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a single mother of two children and all of her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (young sister).  She has been in the beauty salon business. She has been in this business for the last two years and five months. She has applied for shs 100000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more braids weaves and cosmetics. She works from her home and on a retail basis. Gladys doesn’t have any other income generating activities. She works six days a week. Her business challenges include the high prices of braids and cosmetics, and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked salon and also to buy a piece of land to build her own house. Gladys lives in a two roomed hose and the family doesn’t have access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses includes rent, school fees and feeding the family .

loans.use: To buy more boxes of braids weaves and cosmetics.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been a farmer in Njabini for the last seven years. She is 35 years old and a single mother of four schooling children. Apart from farming as her primary activity, she also has a grocery business.

This is her first loan, and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables for sale. She also plans to use part of the amount to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Margaret hopes to expand her farming and grocery businesses and make more income to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 28 years old and married to Simon. Together, they have three children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past seven years.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD. She repaid her previous loan well and in good time. She will use the loan to buy two dairy cows.

She hope to be the best dairy farmer in her area.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 35 years old and married to Cyrus. Together, they have two children. She operates a grocery store and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET by a client. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of tomatoes, carrots and green peppers.

She hopes to expand the general shop to a wholesale one.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of tomatoes, carrots and green peppers.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is 53 years old. She is married to Johnson and together they have three children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 13 years.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She will use the amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for use in her farm.

She hopes to become a renowned farmer in her area.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seedlings for use in her farm.

loans.name: Las Rosas 2 Group

texts.es:
Diana cuenta con con 33 años de edad, es casada tienen 4 hijos los cuales están estudiando Giovanni de 17 años el mayor esta estudiando segundo de colegio bachiller, Luis Adolfo tiene 12 años y estudia cuarto de primaria, cirilo de 10 años esta sexto de primaria, anelis solo tiene 4 años, su esposo se llama elvino es policía.

Ella se dedica al comercio venta de abarrotes invertirá su préstamo en la compra de productos de abarrotes como son: leche, refrescos, huevos, sopas, chiles, etc. Doña diana espera que el negocio le funcione bien tal vez no muy rápido pero si tiene la esperanza de que le vaya mejor con su negocio ya que es una fuente de ingresos que le ayuda mucho a ella y a su familia, le gustaría que el negocio incrementara creciera y así darles una mejor educación a sus hijos ya que su hijo mayor le gustaría seguir estudiando para ser un gran doctor y pues tiene la esperanza que le vaya muy bien. 

Diana pertenece al grupo las rosas 2 el cual esta integrado por 15 mujeres trabajadoras las cuales están comprometidas con el trabajo y a salir adelante a continuación serán mencionadas: Embertina, Cergia, Natividad, Agustina, Elsa, Gaudencia, Luciana, Edith, Margarita, Olivia, Anadelina, Ramira, Abundia, Ma Isabel todas cuenta con una actividad comercial como son: venta de refrescos, venta de productos de abarrotes, servicio de molino para nixtamal, pescadería, tamales, venta de pollos, comida, pan, dulces, etc.
texts.en:
Diana is 33, married and has 4 children in education.  Giovanni, 17, is the oldest and studying 2nd year of Baccalaureate.  Luis Adolfo is 12 and is in his 4th year of primary school; Cirilo is 10 and in year 6 of primary school; Anelis is just 4.  Her husband is called Elvino and he is a police officer. 

Diana sells groceries and will use her loan to buy grocery products such as milk, soft drinks, eggs, soup, chillies etc.  Diana hopes that her business will be a success, perhaps not overnight, but she is hopeful that it will improve things for her, as it provides an income that helps her and her family a lot.  She would like her business to grow so as to be able to provide a better education for her children.  Her oldest son would like to continue studying to become a top doctor, and so she is hopeful that things work out well.

Diana is a member of the “Rosas 2” group, a group of 15 working women who are committed to their work and to getting ahead.  These include: Embertina, Cergia, Natividad, Agustina, Elsa, Gaudencia, Luciana, Edith, Margarita, Olivia, Anadelina, Ramira, Abundia, Ma Isabel.  They all have their own business interests such as selling soft drinks, selling groceries, a milling service for preparing Nixtamal (corn), a fishmonger, making tamales, selling chickens, food, bread, sweets etc.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of soft drinks, oils, eggs, chilles, milk etc.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta sells cooking utensils, becute, toffees, and soft drinks at Mpohor near Takoradi. She is married and has 4 children.  Her husband works with the mining company.  Alberta uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Alberta will use her loan to purchase cooking utensils and groceries to sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business, Alberta wishes to acquire a shop in which she will sell her goods.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 28-year-old lady from Kisumu.  She is married to Kevin, a carpenter, and they have two children aged 10 and eight years.

Janet operates a tailoring shop, a business she has had for the last four years.  She makes a monthly income of KES 17,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy textiles for dressmaking. 

She will use her anticipated profits to pay school fees. Her dream is to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy textiles for dressmaking

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells fried yams, fried fish and chicken, which she has done for 2 years now.  She lives with her husband and one child at Mpohor near Takoradi. Mary uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility and housing bills. Mary will use her loan to purchase yams, fish and chicken to fry for sale. With the new profit, Mary will mount a better stall to sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase yams, fish and chicken to fry for sale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a baker. She bakes bread, meat pies and doughnuts for sale. Catherine has been in this business for six years now.  

She is a single parent. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and to pay their school fees.     

Catherine will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery. She hopes to expand her business from the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa sells second-hand ladies' and children's dresses at Mpohor near Takoradi. She has been selling second-hand dresses for eight years now. 

She is married to a small-scale miner. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills. 

Adjoa needs this loan to purchase more second-hand ladies' and children's dresses to sell. With the new profit, Adjoa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand ladies' and children's dresses to sell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a widowed woman who has seven children, all attending school. She has been running a retail shop for the last 15 years, and she describes price fluctuation as her major drawback. Her other sources of income include sales from farm produce and money from rental houses. She dreams of building another rental house in the future.

She plans to use her loan of Ksh. 50000 to purchase bales of maize flour, wheat flour, and two sacks of sugar. She spends money on school fees during the month.

loans.use: to purchase bales of maize flour, wheat flour, and two sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 36 years old and married to Eunice, who is a farmer. They live in Ndunyu Njeru town and have been blessed with two children, age 10 and 5 years. He does masonry work and has been in this business for the last three years.

Apart from this, he also practices dairy farming. He will use the loan to buy a heifer calf for rearing. With the anticipated profits, he plans to buy more livestock.

In the future, Samuel hopes to grow both his masonry and livestock businesses and make more income to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a heifer calf for rearing.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is the lady pounding fufu (a paste of starchy root vegetables). She operates a chop bar where a variety of African dishes are sold. This she has done for three years now.
