Edison Paul’s dream is to finish his studies and own a house. The main challenge he faces is entering the profession for which he is studying. 

In his free time Edison Paul likes to listen to music.

loans.use: buy a computer

loans.name: Lilibett Patricia

texts.es: Lilibett es socia del Bancomunal Las Entusiastas, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años, es dueña de una combi y se dedica al transporte urbano, también tiene una chacra donde siembra ,le encanta ahorrar y aprender de las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal, porque le ayudan a progresar y ser mas fuerte cuando le suceden algunos problemas, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra una llanta para la combi y de insecticidas para su chacra .
texts.en:
Lilibett is a member of the community bank ‘Las Entusiastas’. She is 30 years old and a mother of three. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 2 years. 

Lilibett owns a van and works in the urban transport business. She also has a small farm where she grows produce. She really likes saving and taking part in training courses at her community bank because this helps her to progress and deal with any problems she encounters. She will invest her loan in a tire for her van and insecticides for her farm.

loans.use: buy a tire for her van and insecticides for her farm

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Siempre Unidos” en el distrito del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por doce personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de celulares, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de boletos turísticos, venta de bebidas naturales, venta de ropa y otros brindan servicios. 
 
(La señora Laura está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Laura nació en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado pero actualmente vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre y soltera y tiene cinco hijos. Su actividad económica principal de Laura es la venta de Comida y tiene un pequeño restaurante. En esta oportunidad Laura requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne, papa, sacos de arroz, verduras, sacos de azúcar, aceite y otras cosas más. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
The communal bank ‘Siempre Unidos’ was formed by a group of neighbours in the district of Cusco. This bank is made up of twelve people who are always on the lookout for opportunities to get ahead and who work to give their children a better future. The members’ economic activities include selling mobile phones, cosmetics, food, tickets for tourists, natural drinks and clothes. Other members provide services.  

Laura, who is the woman holding up her hand in the photo, was born in the city of Puerto Maldonado but she currently lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. She is 55 years old and a single mother of five. Her main economic activity consists in selling food – she has a small restaurant. Laura needs a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, potatoes, sacks of rice, vegetables, sacks of sugar, oil etc.  

The groups’ members are grateful for the opportunity they have been given and are committed to making their various payments on time. 

Cusco is part of the district of Cusco, situated in the southern Cusco province at the heart of an ancient Inca city. It is an area popular with tourists due to its archaeological sites, its historic centre, its landscape, its history and also due to the fact that it is a delightful city. Cusco is known for being a tourism and business hub. The city is also famous for its traditional ‘Inti Raymi’ festival and its proximity to one of the seven wonders of the world, ‘Machu Picchu’.

loans.use: buy ingredients such as meat, potatoes, sacks of rice, vegetables, sacks of sugar, oil etc.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is requesting a new loan to buy more products to stock in her store. 

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. 
She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a wider range of basic goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bella Iris

texts.es: Bella Iris, tiene la edad  de 36 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y tres hijos actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar insumos como abonos, herbicida, foliares, fumigaciones. El tiene pensado comprar todos estos insumos para poder darle un excelente mantenimiento al café, y poder  obtener el máximo de producción y generar más  ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Bella Iris is 36 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children.  

She plans to use her loan to buy items such as fertilisers, herbicides, foliage products and fumigation products. She wants to buy these items to make sure that her coffee plantation is well maintained, so that she can produce as much as possible and generate more income to improve her quality of life and achieve financial stability. 

This will be Bella Iris's first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any loans from government banks in the past. FUDECOSUR is providing her with a loan which is easier to manage and has a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy items such as fertiliser, herbicides, foliage products and fumigation products

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 44 years old. She is married to Hassan. Together they have five children. She operates a cafeteria and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. She will use the loan to purchase more cooking pots and utensils for use in the cafeteria.

She hopes to expand her cafe into a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking pots and utensils for use in the cafeteria.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old and married to Mildred. He operates a retail shop and has been in this business for the past two years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. He will use the loan to purchase stocks of flour, salt and sugar for his shop.

He hopes to expand the retail shop to wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of flour, salt and sugar for his shop.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es socia del Bancomunal Las Entusiastas, tiene 67 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 10 años, es dueña de un terreno llamado ""El León Pampa" donde siembra árboles frutales y plantas ornamentales, ella siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, es una mujer que ha luchado mucho y gracias a FINCA Perú y las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ella pudo aprender los valores que le ayudaron a criar a sus hijos, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de bolsas de tierra negra para la siembra de árboles.
texts.en: Margarita is a member of the Las Entusiastas [Enthusiastic Women] communal bank. She is 67 years old and the mother of 6 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 10 years. She is the owner of some land called "El León Pampa" where she plants fruit trees and ornamental plants. She has always worked in agriculture. She is a woman who has struggled a lot and thanks to FINCA Peru and the trainings she gets in her communal bank, she was able to learn the values that helped her to raise her children. Now the loan she is asking for will be invested in buying bags of black soil to plant trees.

loans.use: to buy bags of black soil for planting trees.

loans.name: Tahopaneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tahopaneh” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a town in eastern Sierra Leone. 

These entrepreneurs have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 3,700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mariatu. Mariatu is 30 years old. She was born in Kenema city, where she is currently residing together with her husband and three children. 

Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For ten years now, Mariatu has been selling cloth (Bamako cloth). With this loan, she will buy a bale of Bamako cloth to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of Bamako cloth to add to her business

loans.name: Bitujuma

texts.en:
Bitujuma  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family.

Bitujuma has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works six days out of every week. Bitujuma sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Bitujuma include seasonality and increased transport costs.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be able to go to Mombasa for clothes and also to become a wholesaler. 

Bitujuma lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Crece Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Crece” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía con telares, preparación de mermeladas orgánicas, venta de joyas, venta de lencería y confección de ropa, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Paulina integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la última fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de izquierda a derecha. Ella es una de las integrantes más altas del grupo, además su cabello es de color negro, lo usa suelto. En la foto solo se aprecia su rostro inclinado hacia la izquierda y su sonrisa.
Paulina se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, desde hace 6 meses.
Su mercadería la compra en el país de Perú y realiza sus compras una vez cada dos meses.
La dinámica de su trabajo, es vender puerta a puerta a sus conocidos, por tanto su horario es flexible. 
Con el crédito, más unos ahorros comprará los pasajes en avión para viajar a Perú, durante el mes de Abril.
Una de las metas para su negocio es realizar sus ventas masivamente, a través de la instalación de un local establecido, de esta manera expandir su negocio.
Paulina vive junto a su marido, uno de sus sueños en el ámbito personal es obtener su casa propia, para esto postulará al subsidio habitacional.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad económica brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que con éste crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones del grupo del Banco comunal, comenta que ha aprendido a distribuir sus ingresos de mejor manera, lo cual le ha servido en su negocio.
Además disfruta de las reuniones, ya que comparte con las demás integrantes, quienes además son muy esforzadas.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Crece” [Grow]. It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different areas. Among them are artisanal crafts such as weaving, making organic jams, selling jewelry, selling lingerie and making clothes, among others. All of them live in the city of  Chillán.

Paulina is a member of the communal bank. In the photo she is in the back row, fourth from the left. She is one of the tallest members of the group and her hair is black and loose. In the photo her face is turning to the left and she is smiling. Paulina has sold new clothing for 6 months. She buys her merchandise in the country of Peru and makes her purchases every two months. She does her job by selling door to door to people she knows and her schedule is flexible. With the loan and some savings she will pay for airfare to travel to Peru during April. One of her goals for her business is to do massive sales with an established locale. This way she can expand her business. 

Paulina lives with her husband and one of her personal dreams is to own her own house. To do this, she will apply for a housing subsidy. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza. This loan will allow her to keep investing in her business. In regards to the trainings given in the communal bank, she remarks that she has learned to distribute her income in a better way, which has helped her business. She also enjoys the meetings, since she shares with the other members who are very hardworking.  

Chillán is a community in the south central area of Chile. Its name means "sun chair" in Mapudungun, the language of our Mapuches indigenous. Chillán is known as the "Cradle of the Nation", or "Land of Artists". The city has produced notable people in Chile's history, such as the well known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy airfare to Peru during April, where she will buy her merchandise.

loans.name: Zoila Jaqueline

texts.es:
Zoila Jaqueline tiene 28 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive en casa de unos familiares en Guaranda  Provincia de Bolívar.

Zoila Jaqueline se dedica a la realizar capacitaciones a los maestros. Solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora y una impresora. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la computadora que tanta falta le hace para  poder realizar trabajos.

La compra lo hará en Guaranda. El sueño es poder  realizar importaciones directos del exterior y crear con ella fuentes de trabajo. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es mantenerse en el trabajo y formar nuevos empresarios.

En el tiempo libre le gusta colaborar con alfabetización y capacitación a Docentes.
texts.en:
Zoila Jaqueline is 28 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives in a family member's house in Guaranda, in Bolívar province.

Zoila Jaqueline's job is training teachers.  She is requesting this loan to buy a computer and a printer.  With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy the computer that she needs so badly to do work on.

Zoila Jaqueline will make her purchase in Guaranda.  Her dream is to be able to import directly from abroad and thereby create jobs.  The challenges that she faces are remaining in her job and training new businesspeople.

In her free time, Zoila Jaqueline enjoys helping to teach reading and writing skills and training teachers.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a printer

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria es socia del Bancomunal Las Entusiastas, tiene 67 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos,ella se dedica a la Agricultura, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años, ella perdió a su esposo hace menos de un año, cada vez que lo recuerda ella llora, pero el asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal le ayudan a tener más tranquilidad, ella esta muy agradecida con FINCA Perú porque le enseñaron a ser fuerte ante las adversidades. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insecticidas y tierra negra para su chacra.
texts.en: Maria is a member of the Las Entusiastas communal bank. She is 67 years old and the mother of 4 children. She works in agriculture and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 5 years. She lost her husband less than a year ago and every time she remembers him she cries. Attending the meetings in her communal bank help her to stay calm. She is very grateful to FINCA Peru because they taught her to be strong when faced with adversity. Now the loan she is asking for will be invested in buying insecticides and black soil for her land.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and black soil for her land.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.

Margret has a business selling used children’s clothes. She has been in this business for six years and she works six days out of every week. Margret sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used children's clothes. She also generates additional income through selling farm produce.

The main business challenge(s) for Margret include seasonality and increased transport costs. Her goals and aspirations for her life and business are to buy a plot and build her own house and also to become a wholesaler.   

Margret lives in a home, which she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used children's clothes

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлане 57 лет, воспитала одну дочь и заботится о трех внуках. Светлана родилась в простой семье - отец и мать были  учителями в местной школе. Закончив школу, Света поступила в Медицинское училище в 1972г.  и в том же году вышла замуж. В 1973 году Света родила дочь, через 6 месяцев после рождения дочери, муж Светы ушел к другой женщине. Будучи сильным человеком, Светлана успешно закончила медучилище  и устроилась  работать медсестрой. В 1985 году Света устроилась медсестрой в психоневрологический дом - интернат, где и работает в настоящее время, стаж работы - 27 лет. Через 10 лет преданной работы, администрация выделила Светлане  квартиру и подсобное хозяйство, где она начала заниматься животноводством. Благодаря упорству, настойчивости и веры в себя, Света одна  смогла вырастить дочь, дать ей образование и в 1990 году – счастливо выдать замуж. На данный момент, дочь с мужем находятся на заработках в России.
В настоящее время Света занимается животноводством - у нее в хозяйстве одна дойная корова, один бык и шесть овец.   В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Светлана обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Светлана планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, что даст возможность помочь дочери, чтобы ей не приходилось покидать детей в поисках заработка.
texts.en:
Svetlana is 57 years old, has raised one daughter and takes care of three grandchildren. Svetlana was born in a simple family; her father and mother were teachers at the local school. After having finished school, Svetlana started medical studies in 1972, and got married in the same year. In 1973 Svetlana gave birth to her daughter, and 6 months after their daughter was born, Svetlana's husband left her for another woman. Being a strong woman, Svetlana succeeded in finishing medical school and got a job as a nurse. 

In 1985 Svetlana started working as a nurse in a psycho-neurological home, an institution where she also works today. Her work experience in this institution is 27 years. After 10 years of devoted work, the administration gave Svetlana an apartment and a private agricultural property, where she started engaging in livestock breeding. 

Thanks to her persistence, perseverance and her belief in herself, Svetlana managed to raise her daughter all by herself, give her an education and in 1990 happily marry her off. Currently the daughter and her husband are migrant workers in Russia. Svetlana is still engaged in livestock breeding, and she has one dairy cow, one bull and six sheep at her farm. 

With an aim to further develop her farm, Svetlana turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of livestock. Svetlana plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her farm, so that she has opportunity to help her daughter, so that she does not have to leave her children in the search of work.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gulbara

texts.ru:
Гульбаре 54 года, воспитала сына. Гульбара работает кассиром и в качестве дополнительного дохода - занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гульбары в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  7 коров, 10 голов овец и 5 коз. Доходы от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляют около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульбара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров, что позволит ей увеличить надои.  Доходы от кредита Гульбара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Gulbara is 54 years old and has raised a son. Gulbara works as a cashier and in as an additional income she is engaged in livestock breeding, having started this business with a sum of 25,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulbara's hard work she today has 7 cows, 10 sheep and 5 goats at her farm. The income from the sale of milk and dairy products is around 5,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulbara turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of dairy cows, which will allow her to increase the milk production. Gulbara plans to invest the income from the loan in further increase the number of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Massama

texts.fr: Massama est un jeune marié sans enfants. Il tient un magasin de vente d'ordinateurs de bureau et d'ordinateurs portables. Il s'approvisionne auprès des grands importateurs de matériels de "seconde main" et revend ses produits en détail. Son commerce lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour compléter son capital et acheter deux ordinateurs. Son ambition est d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Massama is a young married man with no children. He runs a shop selling desk computers and laptops. He gets his products from large importers of second hand equipment, and resells them retail. His business generates a relatively stable income, allowing him to take care of his family's subsistence costs.

In order to strengthen his business, Massama is requesting a loan of 300 000 francs to supplement his capital so that he can buy 2 computers. He aims to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy 2 computers.

loans.name: Mamadou Malé

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamadou Malé est un jeune qui se débrouille dans un peu de tout pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il est âgé de 28 ans, est marié et père de 2 enfants. Actuellement, il travaille comme gardien dans un aéroport en chantier. Il n’est pas seul dans  ce soucis  de faire fasse à la dépense quotidienne du foyer car il est épaulé par sa femme qui fait du petit commerce. C’est d’ailleurs pour elle, qu’il sollicite ce crédit pour lui permettre de payer  de  la marchandise et les frais de transport. Elle vend des tissus depuis 2 ans.
A part la nourriture, il paie aussi les factures d’eau et d’électricité  de la maison.
Dans l’avenir, il aimerait diversifier ses produits et services afin de mieux vivre.
texts.en: Mamadou Malé is a young man who does a bit of everything so that he can provide for his family's needs. He is 28 years old, married and father to two children. He is currently working as a security guard in an airport under construction. He does not have to cope alone with the household expenses as he is helped out by his wife who has a small trading activity. Moreover, it is for her that he is requesting this loan, so that she can pay for goods and their transport. She has been selling fabrics for two years. Apart from paying for food, he also pays the water and electricity bills. In the future he would like to diversify his products and services in order to have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for goods and transport costs pertaining to them (fabrics)

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr:
Kodjovi est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il n’a pas d’enfant.
Kodjovi travaille comme comptable depuis 2007. Il est gestionnaire. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir se déplacer facilement.
Kodjovi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une moto pour mieux se déplacer avec sa famille.
texts.en: Kodjovi is a 32-year old man, who is married to a retailer. He does not have any children. He has been working as an accountant since 2007. His main problem at the moment is that he cannot get around easily. He has thus requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy a motorbike which will allow him to move around more easily with his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Heidy De Los Angeles

texts.es: Heidi de los Ángeles, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar una vaca de leche, para hacer queso y natilla, ella ya cuenta con dos vacas a su poder y tiene pensado fortalecer el negocio de lechería con la compra de esta nueva vaca. Ella tiene pensado vender la producción de queso y natilla en el mercado de la localidad y generar más  ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Heidi de los Ángeles is 30 years old, married, and lives with her husband and four children.  She plans to use this loan to buy a milk cow so that she can make cheese and 'natilla' (a dairy product similar to sour cream).  She already has two cows and is planning to strengthen her dairy business by purchasing a new one.  She plans to sell her cheese and 'natilla' in the town market and thereby make more profits so that she can enjoy a better quality of life and financial stability.

This is the first loan that Heidi de los Ángeles has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received previous loans from State banks but FUDECOSUR have provided her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
This is Nilda. She is 47 years old and a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is single and manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Nilda operates a variety store with the help of a single employee. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go in order to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Rice and fuel are among the item she carries; these being basic necessities. 

She is also a dealer of sawali, a native housing material made out of buho, a species of bamboo indigenous in the Philippines. The bamboo is split, the skin is separated from the body and dried in the sun. Then it is woven to make the sawali, a cheap but durable material for walls and partitions. Located along the national highway, Nilda’s store gets a portion of its sales from commuters and passersby, but the mainstay of her business are the residents of the surrounding rural areas. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

Nilda needs an additional PHP 15,000 for her business. The loan will be used to purchase additional products for her store. A portion of her loan is also used to finance the sawali makers from whom she gets her supply. It will allow her to continue and expand her operations. 

As with all businesspersons, Nilda dreams of expanding and succeeding in her chosen business. Having no family of her own she vows to use the fruits of her enterprise to help others and to save for the future. She also aspires to know Jesus Christ more deeply. She relies on the guidance of her C.C.T. fellowship group in her walk with Christ.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship group gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 25 years old. He is married to Jane and together they have one child. 

He makes homemade lamps and has been in this business for the past four years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. He will use the loan to purchase the raw materials for making lamps.

He hopes to own a manufacturing company and have employees so he can expand his income.

loans.use: to purchase the raw materials for making lamps.

loans.name: Fallou

texts.fr: Fallou est un homme marié, père de trois enfants. Il tient un magasin de vente de tissus et d'articles de mercerie.Ce commerce lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses propres besoins ainsi que les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter des tissus et des articles de mercerie. Son ambition est d'agrandir son magasin.
texts.en:
Fallou is married and the father of 3 children. He runs a shop selling fabric and second hand clothing. This business earns him an income which allows him to provide for himself and take care of his family's maintenance needs.

Fallou is requesting a loan of 300 000 francs in order to strengthen his capital so that he can buy some fabrics and second hand clothing. His ambition is to expand his shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric and second hand clothing.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a younger sister). 

Rose has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for three years and she works six days out of every week. Rose sells her products from home, by means of retail.   

Rose has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenge(s) for Rose include a rainy season and thieves.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business and her life are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot and build her own house. Rose lives in a home, which she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  

Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
This is Arlyn. She is 34 years old and a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Freddie, a self-employed furniture maker, and a mother to her three children. Two of them are in grade school with the youngest not yet of school age. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide an income for their everyday expenses.

Arlyn has been operating a variety store for the past 12 years in Palawan. Essentially, a variety store is a small convenience store, which retails basic necessities, such as canned goods, beverages, toiletries and, in rural areas such as Busuanga, even rice and gasoline. Arlyn earns by buying in bulk, marking these up and selling by the piece. She nets around PHP 335 daily from the operation of her store and from selling sawali on the side.

Arlyn needs PHP 16,000 to add to her existing capital. She believes that this amount would help her sustain and expand her business. It would be used to boost the product inventory of her store. And it would also enable her to order more sawali from her suppliers to cope with the rising demand due to the upswing of construction in the surrounding areas.

Arlyn’s 12 years in business is a testimony to her grit and determination to succeed. She has had her share of challenges. Chief among them are delayed payments from her customers. She has also learned the lesson that profit from business should be plowed back into the enterprise to make it viable and strong. This in turn will ultimately ensure her family’s future.

A firm believer that education is the path to a brighter tomorrow, Arlyn dreams of seeing all her three children finish college. An active C.C.T. partner, Arlyn meets with her co-fellowship members every Monday to give mutual support, pray for one another and study scriptures as well as to monitor the status of individual loans.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Khadim

texts.fr: Khadim est un homme marié, sans enfants. Il s'active dans le commerce de cartes de recharge téléphoniques.Cette activité lui rapporte des revenus assez intéressants du fait de la pluralité des opérateurs téléphoniques dans son pays. Il prend ainsi en charge l'essentiel des dépenses d'entretien de sa famille ainsi que ses propres besoins.Afin de renforcer son stock de cartes, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des cartes de recharge de téléphonie mobile des différents opérateurs.Son ambition est d'installer une cantine de vente de téléphones portables, d'accessoires et de cartes de recharge.
texts.en:
Khadim is married and has no children. He sells prepaid phone charge cards. His business generates pretty substantial revenues thanks to the plurality of telecom operators in his country. He is therefore able to cover most of his family's maintenance costs, as well as providing for his own needs.

In order to replenish his inventory of mobile phone cards, Khadim is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs to buy prepaid cards from the different operators. He aims to open a little store in the market selling mobile phones, accessories and charge cards.

loans.use: to buy prepaid charge cards.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 39 years old. She lives in the Kobuleti District with her family: her husband – Vazha, her 16-year-old son and her father-in-law. Ketevan’s son goes to school. 

The family earns a living through agricultural businesses. They have a milk cow and Ketevan produces cheese and sells it in the village. The family also grows citrus and maize on the family-owned 0.5 hectare of land. Ketevan and Vazha sell the harvested products in the local market. 

As well as the aforementioned businesses, Ketevan is busy with beekeeping. The family owns 13 beehives with bee families. They harvest on average 150 liters of honey per year and sell in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Laris, including Ketevan’s father-in-law's pension. 

Ketevan requested credit to purchase an additional four beehives and bee colonies. With 17 bee colonies, the family will harvest and sell 25% more honey. The income of the family will increase and the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beehives with bee colonies

loans.name: 04.07.10 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hưng is applying for a loan to purchase coal to make processed coal for resale. She has a manufacturing business making coal.

Hưng is 53-years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent, 3 other children left school and they can work to support themseft.

Hưng is the group leader of the 04.07.10 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2011, Hưng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hưng has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hưng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main harship that Hưng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hưng hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase coal to make processed coal for resale.

loans.name: 03-8-87-Quang Hung Group

texts.en:
Hướng works in agricultural farming raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and resell in the future. Hướng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Hướng is 44-years-old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, 2 children left school and they can work to support themseft.

Hướng is the group leader of the 03-8-87-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. This is Hướng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

The main harship that Hướng faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hướng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Edelberto

texts.en:
Edelberto is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Edelberto has a pigpen and sells grown & matured pigs. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Edelberto has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Edelberto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy aninmal feed for pigs

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is 60 years old, married, and has seven children. She resides at Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Remegia used her last loan to purchase additional products to resell. 

By now, she is taking a new loan for her transport business to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria, 50, a resident of Manila, Philippines.  Her husband is Perfecto, a seaman. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Victoria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Victoria dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa es socia del Bancomunal Las Entusiastas, tiene 27 años de edad, es madre de un hijo, es dueña de un moto-taxi,   es socia FINCA Perú hace 2 años, las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal le ayudan en su vida personal así como en su negocio ya que ahora va a invertir en un nuevo negocio que es la venta de palomitas de maíz, esta muy feliz por todo lo que ha logrado ahorrar, y orgullosa de todo lo que pudo lograr.Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una máquina para hacer palomitas de maíz.
texts.en: Elsa is a member of 'Las Entusiastas' community bank.  She is 27 years old and has one child.  She owns a motorcycle taxi.  Elsa has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years.  The training sessions she receives as a member of her community bank help her in her personal life and also in her business.  She is about to invest in a new business selling popcorn.  She is very happy with what she has managed to save and proud of everything she has been able to accomplish.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying a popcorn machine.

loans.use: to buy a machine for making popcorn

loans.name: 05.08.32 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung has a retail business selling soft drink. She is requesting a loan to purchase drink (beer, coca,organe ... to resell.

Nhung is 53 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Nhung is the group leader of the 05.08.32 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. Nhung lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province, her children are grown up and left school. They have a job but not a good job.

In 2010, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhung has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nhung has been involved in this business for 6 years. The main hardship that Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
This is Nena, 55, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a single parent and a mother to her child. She manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Nena operates a food stall. She sells snacks like burgers, noodles, coffee and other street food staples and also cooked viands that she sells in their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw products and supplies she use in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nena dreams of giving her child a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is a 61-year-old married man, a father of 5 children and the husband of a businesswoman. He lives in Balintawak, Aurora, Zambo. del Sur.

Romulo used his last loan to purchase seedlings. His business been profitable, and he is taking a new loan to acquire more products such as shampoo, milks, soaps and etc.  In the future he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to acquire more products such as shampoo, milks, soaps and etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 5 years, Marilyn has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, snacks and beverages. Marilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, shampoo, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 54 years old and lives in Brgy. 2, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 
Marilou has a  business of general store and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan amount of 10,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store . Marilou joined PMPC just this year.
In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Nary, 38, is married and resides with her husband, three children and a sister in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sticky rice cake for over 10 years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 4 per day. Her sister is a clothes seller who earns about USD 8 per day. In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Nary is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more clothes for her sister to sell. This loan would enable her to get more fashionable clothes to sell and attract more clients. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new wooden house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately 3 U.S. dollars (USD) per day. Her husband runs a public-transportation service (motor taxi) and earns about 6 USD per day. Because his present motorbike is too old, Vanna is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a new motorbike for him to run his taxi service. This purchase will enable her husband to attract more customers and generate more income to support the family. In the future, Vanna would like to run a sewing shop, build a concrete house, and help her children get a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his public-transportation service (motor taxi)

loans.name: Savon

texts.en: Savon, 39, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for over two years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about USD 3 per day. Since the land in the village next to her house is cheap, Savon requests a loan of USD 1000 to purchase land in order to resell it for a profitable price. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child get a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase land in order to resell it for a profitable price.

loans.name: Manuelen

texts.en:
Manuelen works hard to support 5 children. She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night. Manuelen is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase solar lamp.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is separated and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 1800 through NWTF to buy an envirofit cooking stove.  She is getting the envirofit because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer. Envirofit stoves needs less fuel to cook food.

Rosalinda is aware that by using the envirofit, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an envirofit cooking stove.
